intro: Ajuga decumbens var. vegeta, commonly known as carpet bugleweed, is a low-growing perennial herb native to eastern North America. It features dark green, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in spike-like clusters during late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its dense foliage makes it a popular choice for ground cover in shaded garden settings.
